word:
Brother Burden, I have written a great deal of late in regard to the subject of food manufacture. We are not to 


                              -186- 

allow Dr. Kellogg's plans in regard to the corn flakes cause a large investment of money that should be invested in less expensive preparations of food. We will deal in foods that will require such an outlay of means in order to secure the privilege of using them. I will send to you copies of some things I have written on this subject. (These will be sent soon. D.E.R.")
